Beverly officer shooting

Officer said he had 'moment of weakness' but no affair

DA explains findings in Beverly shooting

Jason Lantych told his superiors that the wife of the sergeant who shot him "poured her heart out to me,'' but he insisted they were never intimate. (Globe, 5:01 p.m.)

Back Bay fire, outages

NStar says power restored, but residents disagree; manhole fires force closures

NStar said that they had used "jumper cables" to restore power to the thousands of customers who had been without electricity since Tuesday night. (Globe, 6:17 p.m.)

Pictures

The mane course: Lions, tigers get blackout leftovers

Capital Grille, forced to throw out its meat after the Back Bay power outage, donated the choice cuts to the Southwick Zoo. (Boston Globe)

Study: Exercise may increase infertility

In a new study, researchers found women attempting to get pregnant who exercised vigorously had a 42 percent reduced likelihood of getting pregnant. (Globe, 2:48 p.m.)
